arm_group.description:
18 to 85 years of age
Able to provide independent, informed consent
Independent function by self-report
Free of any health ailment that would impair physical function

Unilateral transradial or wrist-disarticulation amputee
18 to 85 years of age
At least 1 year from date of amputation
Be able to independently provide informed consent
Be willing to comply with study procedures

brief_summary.textblock:
This study will compare the functional performance of voluntary opening (VO) and voluntary
      closing (VC) body powered prostheses. We hypothesize that the ability to sense cable tension
      and produce progressively higher pinch from shoulder force will result in advantages for the
      VC terminal device (TRS, Grip 3) in terms of proprioception, grip strength, overall
      function, and quality of life. The specific aims of this clinical trial are to:

        1. Determine if accommodation with a VC Grip 3 prehensor will result in improved grip
           force.

        2. Determine if accommodation with a VC Grip 3 prehensor will result in improved movement
           symmetry and reduced compensatory motion during activity.

        3. Determine if accommodation with a VC Grip 3 prehensor will result in improved function
           in activities of daily living by self-report.

clinical_study.brief_title: Functional Performance of Voluntary Opening and Closing Body Powered Prostheses

detailed_description.textblock:
To evaluate the performance of the prehensors, subjects will complete a randomized A-B
      crossover study with a subjective follow-up. Two subject categories will be evaluated: 1.)
      healthy non-amputees using a unilateral prosthesis simulator, and 2.) unilateral transradial
      amputee subjects who currently use, or are interested in using a body-powered prosthesis. We
      anticipate data collection data with 10 non-amputee subject, and approximately 8 amputee
      subjects.  Non-amputee subjects will perform the same randomization, test, and short surveys
      as the amputee subjects, except they will have a 1-hour accommodation immediately prior to
      testing, will have a minimum of 1 week between Phase A and Phase B testing, and will not
      complete the follow-up survey.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria

          -  Unilateral transradial or wrist-disarticulation amputee

          -  18 to 85 years of age

          -  At least 1 year from date of amputation

          -  Be able to independently provide informed consent

          -  Be willing to comply with study procedures Exclusion criteria

          -  History of acute or chronic skin breakdown on the residual limb

          -  Prosthetic socket adjustment within 90 days

          -  Any condition that would prevent participation and pose increased risk (e.g. shoulder
             impingement, sub-acromial bursitis, severe arthritis of the shoulder, elbow, wrist,
             or fingers)

          -  Injuries of the upper limb within the past 90 days (surgeries, sprains, strains, or
             fractures).

          -  Unwillingness/inability to follow instructions Inclusion criteria for able-bodied
             subjects

          -  18 to 85 years of age

          -  Able to provide independent, informed consent

          -  Independent function by self-report

          -  Free of any health ailment that would impair physical function Exclusion criteria for
             able-bodied subjects

          -  Younger than 18 or older than 85 years of age

          -  Any condition that would prevent participation and pose increased risk (e.g. shoulder
             impingement, sub-acromial bursitis, severe arthritis of the shoulder, elbow, wrist,
             or fingers)

          -  No injuries of the upper limb within the past 90 days (surgeries, sprains, strains,
             or fractures).

          -  Unwillingness/inability to follow instructions

clinical_study.official_title: A Clinical Trial Comparing Functional Performance of Voluntary Opening and Closing Body Powered Prosthetic Terminal Devices

primary_outcome.description: Unilateral, bilateral lift, cut play dough with knife and fork and folding a towel tasks will be timed.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of blocks moved in allotted time

primary_outcome.description: The test assesses balance, upper and lower body strength, upper body function and endurance. Additionally, an aggregate score is produced which in addition to providing an empirical point comparison also provides an indication as to the level of dependency in ADL function a subject may require.

The TAPES is a Rasch analyzed, valid and reliable instrument. Following multiple psychometric analyses, the instrument was revised as the TAPES-R which is the version utilized in the proposed protocol to assess perceived function and quality of life.
primary_outcome.measure: Trinity Amputation and Prosthesis Experience Scales-Revised (TAPES-R)Score

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Elbow joint angles during tasks.  Measured using an 8 camera motion analysis system.
Shoulder joint angles during tasks.  Measured using an 8 camera motion analysis system.
Torso joint angles during tasks.  Measured using an 8 camera motion analysis system.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case-Crossover, Time Perspective: Prospective
